column4: how do i soft reboot into bios, when i click on eboot it only reboots linux without hardresetting the computer, what is wrong???
i too cant access grub wtf
do i have to shutdown my computer to hard-reboot???
i dont want restart linux i want reBOOT
here is a trick for you: sudo echo b > /proc/sysrq-trigger   :)
kinda like hitting reset button on pc
i want it to properly unmount my ext4 thanks
there are a number of commands for clean reboot.  for instance sudo shutdown -r now  or sudo reboot
well that sudo reboot is doing the same thing than hitting on reboot no bios
if you still see the same issue then it would have to be some quick boot bios setting causing it not ubuntu
during quickboot you can still hit the proper key like f1 or f8 or whatever is specific to your comp to get into the bios
there is no bios feature in the world that lets you skip loading the bios, it is ubuntu problem just reloading the kernel but noot resetting the mashine before
that did not work as i said
it immediately loads ubuntu again not accepting f8 or del
